body_html: @martinraison I think x.div(y) with y sparse should just not work, but you can add x.div(y, 1e-10) for the non-nan style division. In fact, you can do it for dense tensors too, since this seems quite a common operation sometimes.
body_text: @martinraison I think x.div(y) with y sparse should just not work, but you can add x.div(y, 1e-10) for the non-nan style division. In fact, you can do it for dense tensors too, since this seems quite a common operation sometimes.
body: @martinraison I think x.div(y) with y sparse should just not work, but you can add x.div(y, 1e-10) for the non-nan style division. In fact, you can do it for dense tensors too, since this seems quite a common operation sometimes.
